website_summaries.verdict: An affordable, convenient choice with a lifetime warranty that adds to its worth. The best value for those who want to carry water and not much else.
pros: Easy to use and clean w/a versatile tube that can be used on either side of the pack
cons: Mesh pocket for carrying extra items does not seem very durable and does not provide much space

customer_reviews.title: Good enough, esp for the price
customer_reviews.text: For the price you just can't beat this pack. It isn't exactly ergonomic, and the water bladder makes everything taste plasticy. The straps can be somewhat cutting. There are no side pockets for storage. But none of that matters because what you're actually here for is the price. The price is so insanely low compared to other brands you kind of forget all the downsides. If you're doing long runs this isn't for you. If you like water to taste like water this isn't for you. If you need accessible storage - again this isn't for you. But if you want cheap and good enough to get by on a medium run or hike this is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: philwinkle

customer_reviews.title: Great hydration system for trail running; not great customer service
customer_reviews.text: A great hydration backpack for running. It took a little while for me to figure out that my drinking issue could be solved by making the bite valve opening a bit larger. Since then, it’s been great. I use on runs of 10 to 20 miles and find it comfortable and convenient. The chest strap is oddly small. But, I do not have a big chest, so that’s been OK for me. UPDATE: The bladder sprung a leak in the seam. I have contacted Teton because it occurred during the warranty period for that component. I have heard nothing since the automated email reply ... more than a week ago. Disappointing!
customer_reviews.author: DK

customer_reviews.title: 🚰 wish an easier dispenser tuck
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this hydrobag with money I earned myself. My dignity is not for sale. I appreciate the fine attention to detail in this product: the tight seam work, the alignment of additions, the great resistance to tension, the inner bag water liner. The various straps help conduct the water tubing in place, but I dearly wish there as a pouch in strap for tucking the water nozzle as many times the bag set on someone's floor, the hose sprawls, the nozzle finds its way into floor contact picking up mouth-hostile debris.
customer_reviews.author: 🛡️ veracity 🛡️

customer_reviews.title: I replaced the bladder it came with with a Camelbak and it works like a dream
customer_reviews.text: Frequent festival goer for volunteer activities. This pack is a miracle worker for long days standing in the sun or walking around. I replaced the bladder it came with with a Camelbak and it works like a dream. Highly recommend if all you need is something to carry your water bladder and maybe some keys. (cause it doesn't have any other pockets)
customer_reviews.author: S. Le

customer_reviews.title: Orange is actually yellow
customer_reviews.text: Super disappointed that the orange is actually very yellow, not at all like the pictures or description. The backpack may work well for you but if you were looking specifically for orange, like I was, don’t get this one. It was a gift for my husband, whose favorite color is orange, and now I have to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Tube keeps getting twisted at the bottom
customer_reviews.text: The sleeve design for the bladder makes the tube coming out of it bunch up at the bottom obstructing water flow - have to keep adjusting it. The twist cap fell off after a few uses. Filling it up at the hydration stations in a music festival requires special attention since filling mechanism is so inconvenient that the mouthpiece+tube tends to fall into the yucky water puddle as you fumble around.
customer_reviews.author: SG

customer_reviews.title: yellow not orange as pictured
customer_reviews.text: No matter what do the chest strap won't move up far enough to get above my chest (female) so I have to leave it un buckled and just use the waist strap. It doesn't move when I run, but I do have to work on tucking those buckle pieces so they don't tub on my arm the entire run. Other than that, it looks orange in the picture but is actually yellow. Easy to use, I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Lesley Lyon Mullinix

customer_reviews.title: Good starter pack.
customer_reviews.text: Good for the price point. Comfortable on the back and shoulders and ok insulation / padding. Orange color is defiantly yellow however. Would have preferred orange as pictured. Knocking off a star for color only.
customer_reviews.author: S. Reigel

customer_reviews.title: Good bag, not so great bladder.
customer_reviews.text: Update: it leaked on me both times, first time I wore it I hadn't realized it was leaking, thought it was sweat. But second time it leaked more and I noticed and had to spill the water and continue without. Leaks from the base of the hose, I tightened it, it still leaked.
customer_reviews.author: Amir Mograbi

customer_reviews.title: Does the job; perfect for marathoners!
customer_reviews.text: I wore this while training for the Marine Corps Marathon. It is lightweight, holds a good amount of water, and has room for snacks, keys, etc. The mouthpiece is a little hard to draw from if you are tired (takes some force), though that is not unique to this pack. It has held up well through training. I rarely use the waist belt as I like to snug it up pretty high on my back. It is easy to fill because it has a large screw-on cap on the bladder. It is a little challenging to fully empty so that it can dry (make sure to blow air through the mouthpiece so the tubing is not full of water.
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: Good cheap(er) hydration pack.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my big 8 year old. (He's the size of an average 12 year old.). He wears it fine. Took it for hikes during our Yellowstone trip. He did not complain of weight or discomfort. Even when the bladder was full. Bladder and bite valve worked great. No leaks to complain about. Very much like a Camelbak, it's a pain to clean and dry the bladder. I'm not a fan of the sheen of the bag, it just looks a tad cheap. That's more about style than function, but enough for me to not be completely happy with it. Kid didn't care either way.
customer_reviews.author: Arian Alonzo

customer_reviews.title: Not great for running
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pack for long distance running. The weight and fit are good, the nozzle could use some improvement. I like the storage capacity, I can throw my phone and I.D. In the mesh. My big complaint is that it has slow water delivery, when running it’s hard to suck for very long between breaths.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Schneider

customer_reviews.title: Love the color
customer_reviews.text: I used to have a 50 ounce camelbak but I just the water pouch for it and I was going camping in Idaho and needed something. Prime day happened a week before I went camping and I snagged this beauty. It's honestly a good one, especially since it holds more water than my camelbak, it's not heavy when I have it on and it stays pretty secure. Plus, orange is my favorite color so this one is awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Noah Bowser

customer_reviews.title: Works Good.. So I Thought.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use while training in a racing wheelchair. It works fantastic. The only complaint I could give is in my case I would like the tubing just a bit longer. Update. I bought this on June 25th. Today is July 19th. The velcro used to close the bag has half ripped off by the stitching. I have re rated this at 3 stars but the velcro should not be ripping off within a month. August 10 Bag no longer functions as it should.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Moore

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs down on ancient bladder design
customer_reviews.text: The bladder, and it's need to have the drink hose attached is awful to use. Unlike other bladders that have a valve, you have to fill the bladder then try to feed the hose through the back of the pack. Or you have to snake the hose through the loops, and fill the bladder whilst it is half out of the backpack. I threw it away and used my hydra pack bladder instead.
customer_reviews.author: ron tartaglia

customer_reviews.title: the tube connected to the waterbag leaks
customer_reviews.text: the bag itself that carries the water bag is very comfortable to wear. i am 6'0 with broad shoulders and it works for me the problem i have is the drinking tube that connects to the water bag LEAKS. i have now used this on 3 hikes within the last 2 weeks and blue tube that connects to the water bag leaks water. it does not stay tight. it is a twists cap so it loosens and leaks it does not stay tight.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle  Turnof

customer_reviews.title: Awkward fit
customer_reviews.text: This fit very awkwardly and looked silly on me. One side strap was higher than the other side. And the tube needed to be a little longer. The strap across the belly was awkward. Overall just didn't fit right and I am a fit guy.
customer_reviews.author: lab128

customer_reviews.title: Maybe for hanging out in the back yard -- but ...
customer_reviews.text: Maybe for hanging out in the back yard -- but not for serious physical activity !!! takes way too long for water to actually make it to the mouth piece, then bite valve leaks for next minute or so wasting water, chest strap is at throat level when bag is full, have to pull valve out so hard the bite valve will come off, if you bend - the pressure against bag will cause water to leak out of the hose
customer_reviews.author: David Crabtree

customer_reviews.title: Leaked from the start
customer_reviews.text: We ordered two of these and one leaked from the start and will not stop. The bladder system is below standard.
customer_reviews.author: Tami

customer_reviews.title: Leaked water, cheap material
customer_reviews.text: It leaked water from day one, can't really use one of these if it leaks water. Water leaked into my car, onto my hardwood floors - hardwood floor now squeaks because of this.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT for the price!!!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this thing! No problems with it AT ALL! As with most backpacks that are used for hiking/outdoor use, but some people still don't know about is the clip. It actually is a whistle that can be used in case you're ever in trouble!
customer_reviews.author: J Flannery

customer_reviews.title: Hold onto you like a spider monkey
customer_reviews.text: Holds onto you like a spider monkey! I’m not the smallest man (5’9” about 200lb.) and it fits right onto my spine so snug I barely even know it’s their. Great for running as well once you get used to the water sloshing around. Also fits my much shorter, much lighter girlfriend due to the adjustable straps. Highly recommend for a lightweight water pack
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The pack is nice, but the hydration bladder leaked from day one
customer_reviews.text: I honestly really like the design of the bag, but the bladder inside leaks from the junction of the bladder and hose. This means a constant we drip all over the backside. I would honestly recommend this if the quality of the bladder inside wasn't so low.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I've only used this once so far, but I'm really happy with it. I ran a 6.5 race in super hot and humid weather, wearing a tank top. No rubbing on the shoulders, didn't feel extra hot with it in my back, no bouncing, just all around comfortable. I think the mouthpiece is strange to get used to, but I've never had anything like this before. I didn't have any issue with the taste of the water either.
customer_reviews.author: Pati

customer_reviews.title: Orange Is Yellow
customer_reviews.text: Great pack but don’t order the orange if you want orange! It is very yellow. Will definitely still use it just not as happy with the color.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald C Flake

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good quality!
customer_reviews.text: Was shipped the wrong color but it works great and holds a good amount. The waist strap keeps it from bouncing while running!
customer_reviews.author: Jose Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Where have you been all my life? WoW
customer_reviews.text: I have to say. Hydration packs! Where have you been my whole life? WOW. I wore this a whole race weekend at COTA. It was awesome! I have also worn this while riding a motorcycle and it was great. Love it. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Sammy Chon

customer_reviews.title: Well built, cheaper option to the market leader...
customer_reviews.text: Nicely designed and built product that was just what I was looking for. Only reason for 4 versus 5 stars is that it has taken quite a while to get the "plasticky" taste to dissipate. Have used for skiing, biking and hiking. Definitely helps to stay hydrated when doing these activities.
customer_reviews.author: Roger S

customer_reviews.title: I love it but...
customer_reviews.text: I love the actual pack. The size is perfect and the weight is great for a day trip. I can carry my keys, a pack of tissues, doggie poop bags, and a few other items in the mesh pouch. However, the taste in the bladder is hideous. I cannot drink from it as the taste actually makes my mouth pucker with the taste of chemicals.
customer_reviews.author: The Grunaus

customer_reviews.title: The bite valve sucks, but if you could replace it - everything else was alright.
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this back for an outdoor festival, It held up fine, but the bite valves design is terrible. The stop is push pull system and the suction on the mouth piece was so strong that it almost gave you a headache trying to drink from it. We tried to remedy this by widening the slit in the piece but it did little to help. The actual bag is pretty high quality, though it is more goldenrod/yellow than orange - the only real problem with it that I would say is that bite valve.
customer_reviews.author: PaulsenFamily

customer_reviews.title: perfect pack for running!
customer_reviews.text: I work at a festival, and this helps keep me hydrated, while being out of the way!
customer_reviews.author: Alan Bell

customer_reviews.title: Great for marathon training in hot weather environments
customer_reviews.text: I'm training for a marathon in summer months in Hong Kong, that means humidity! I do 16 mile runs and it's a necessity. If I was training elsewhere, maybe not so. It fits nicely, very comfortable. My one concern is the 'bite' nozzle, it has come off once or twice while running. However, I'm very happy with this purchase just what I needed for this hot weather training.
customer_reviews.author: TTW

customer_reviews.title: Leak problem
customer_reviews.text: The bladder has a small rip that is undetectable by sight. The first time I used it it leaked 2 litres of water into my pack and soaked my gear. I was on a hiking trip in the smoky mountains and my spare clothes and much of my other supplies were soaked. The Trailrunner itself is great, just wish the bladder was as good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie Cray

customer_reviews.title: Great waterpack for a low price
customer_reviews.text: I was shopping for a jogging bag that wouldn't bounce everywhere when I ran with the pooch and could easily carry anything I needed. That's when I came across CamelBaks and similar ideas. I found that most of these were too pricey to try out but luckily found this bag. It works great and didn't cost a fortune.
customer_reviews.author: josh

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product! This pack carries 2 liters of water close to the body, making it easy to move about. I use this pack for running, and it holds plenty of water to stay hydrated on a 4-mile run on a hot day (I do refrigerate the water). I have bought two of these: one for myself and one for my husband. I like that the straps are so adjustable that the pack fits either of us. I am 110 pounds and he is 190 pounds.
customer_reviews.author: Betsey Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Perfect way to stay hydrated.
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for an afternoon out or a day trip. I used the water bladder for a longer trip by simply pulling it out and inserting it into my backpack. So, there is some versatility with the parts. I really like this.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Goldweber

customer_reviews.title: The only pocket is on the back so you'll need ...
customer_reviews.text: The only pocket is on the back so you'll need another pack or handheld to hold stuff without having to take off the pack to reach things in the mesh sleeve. Otherwise a value buy for a hydration pack.
customer_reviews.author: Owen

customer_reviews.title: high quality/ low price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my Camelbak Rogue after having leakage issues with 2 different water bags. So far so good! I did notice some water splashing from the hose during runs but that turned out to be because I neglected to close the mouthpiece all the way. I love this bag for its small lightweight design and so far lack of leaks. The hose screws in instead of clicking in like my Camelbak but at about 1/3 the price, I'll take it! I was dubious at first but I'm developing a deep love for this bag. :)
customer_reviews.author: Penny Dreadful

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: The is a great product for any activity when hydration is important. Just the right size and easy to clean!
customer_reviews.author: David Downs

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and cary
customer_reviews.text: It’s a nice light size. Easy to carry around all day. I’ve really liked using it.
customer_reviews.author: orangedaisys

customer_reviews.title: Just OK..,
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for on this item. Tends to leak a bit and despite everything I've tried, I can't get rid of the silicone taste from the mouth piece. If you plan to use it on a frequent basis you may want to invest in something a bit higher quality. For infrequent use, it's a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Donna V

customer_reviews.title: great value, features
customer_reviews.text: Used by my teen on a 12 day trip to Arizona in August. He ditched the bite valve, just used the twist valve. Fills easily at the sink or bottle refill stations. Mesh pocket holds snacks, sunblock stick, small items. Chest strap and waist strap increase comfort when hiking. Fit under a PFD while kayaking.
customer_reviews.author: NoVA_Mom

customer_reviews.title: Worked great. Lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Bought for use on my first hikes out in the desert. Worked great. Lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn the 2nd

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for tour
customer_reviews.text: I use this as a hot run pack to carry my phone and light hydration. The fit is large, but it is a very light pack.
customer_reviews.author: GatorCross

customer_reviews.title: Tho I liked the colors and the lightweight feel - the bottom ...
customer_reviews.text: Tho I liked the colors and the lightweight feel - the bottom snap (under my ribcage) did not actually "snap" - it wouldn't push closed enough. Kept popping open. But that's not even the worst part - I could not get the bladder to drain water properly into the hose. I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Very small low quality
customer_reviews.text: Very small and poor quality materials. No room for storage of any kind. Difficult to drink from and leaked right away.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron chamberlain

customer_reviews.title: Nice light hydration pack.
customer_reviews.text: Works really well and is very light. I bought it for my wife and she has had no issues. The outside pocket is large enough to hold a trail snack. The bladder has a reasonable sized whole but sits down a little from the top which makes completely emptying it a little bit difficult.
customer_reviews.author: T. Adams

customer_reviews.title: Love it, wish there were more pockets
customer_reviews.text: No padding on the straps but still comfortable. To me it feels like the same quality as the camelbak. The water vessel works great but if you want you can also fit a 2 liter camelbak water pack in this bag.
customer_reviews.author: Ellie 1995

customer_reviews.title: great hydration pack
customer_reviews.text: Fits well. Easy to use. Lasted all day at the zoo when it was over 100 degrees. Says twist to open the mouth piece, you actual pull it up. besides that it holds a lot of water and is great!
customer_reviews.author: lmwy83

customer_reviews.title: Nice build quality and construction
customer_reviews.text: Nice build quality and construction. Had some difficulty with the straw tube and the mouthpiece, ended up just using it with the bite-and-suck mouthpiece removed. Refilling wasn't too hard but definitely not as convenient as some of the more expensive ones. All in all, great product for the price point and good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: rc

customer_reviews.title: perfect. Didn't leak for me
customer_reviews.text: perfect. Didn't leak for me. 4 stars only bc running it chaffed a bit after 45 min. Will wear a t shirt with sleeves and be fine
customer_reviews.author: Betsy

customer_reviews.title: Happy
customer_reviews.text: So far very happy with the fit and quality. Will be using it for Spartan Races. If I could change one thing, it would be a tiny bit more space or a pocket for goos and such. The color looks great in person (I got the orange).
customer_reviews.author: R. Seebach

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight and very comfortable, even for extended periods of time. The bladder is good quality and it has enough storage space for a few basic items.
customer_reviews.author: Wes

customer_reviews.title: Good budget hydration pack
customer_reviews.text: Great discount bag. Perfect for short trails or trips while minimizing what you carry. The water bladder is not high quality, but does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Y Chang

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: This was half the price of a Camelback and every bit as functional and durable. I used this to run a Spartan race and it held up strong the entire time. Will use it again for the next one, as well as any hiking through the mountains. Great value!!
customer_reviews.author: Rob R

customer_reviews.title: ... just got this pack & used it once already great product. I like the netted pocket
customer_reviews.text: I just got this pack & used it once already great product. I like the netted pocket. I can put snacks & other items. Very comfortable & light. I am very petite & I am able to adjust straps to fit me.
customer_reviews.author: Frango

customer_reviews.title: Hole upon arrival
customer_reviews.text: Had a hole where the “straw” is attached to the water bag as soon as it arrived. Never used it. Will be looking at other brands
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is awesome.
customer_reviews.text: Great quality for the money. The bladder is a little cheap, but the pack itself is very well done. I would recommend it to anyone needing a daypack or a hyrdopack.
customer_reviews.author: Jason McCullough

customer_reviews.title: Best Value. Period...
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't be without this on my doggie hikes. Lightweight, low profile, well made. Fantastic value....
customer_reviews.author: Missy Moo

customer_reviews.title: Gives you water only when you don't need it.
customer_reviews.text: Wow, does this thing not work. The pro: it's lightweight. The cons: 1. The mouthpiece leaks, in a constant slow drip. 2. Unfortunately, when you actually WANT water, you can't get it. The bite-valve is so incredibly finicky that it's pretty much impossible to get it right to get any liquid.
customer_reviews.author: Mark S

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Love it. It is a nice small size and the pouch in the back is perfect for my dog's bottle. Only thing I don't like is there is no zippered pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tip: I know the mouth piece says "twist" to ...
customer_reviews.text: Tip: I know the mouth piece says "twist" to open, but you actually just need to pull it out. I was so frustrated, twisting it and about bursting a blood vessel trying to get water out.
customer_reviews.author: Chkn_Tika

customer_reviews.title: Abused and still works fine
customer_reviews.text: I wore this pack in 3 different hare scramble races. I wrecked while wearing this pack no less than a dozen times. It's been a good product, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: SoftwareDevJsn

customer_reviews.title: Dont waste yoir money
customer_reviews.text: Went to use this for the first time and it came with a hole where the tube meets the bag
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good, but...
customer_reviews.text: Overall I like the product. However, after only one use the mouth piece fell off and is no where to be found. The product still works just not how intended.
customer_reviews.author: jbcarter07

customer_reviews.title: Super cute
customer_reviews.text: Love this little pack for short daily hikes. Super cute pack.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne

customer_reviews.title: Well made!
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised at how well this is made. Haven't had a chance to use it but am impressed so far!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Leaky bladder and wrong color.
customer_reviews.text: It broke before I could use it, leak in the bladder. Also was yellow, not orange. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: J. Sepulveda

customer_reviews.title: Good product incorrect color.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered the color ORANGE and it is YELLOW. I realy wanted orange because all of my outdoor and workout equipment is orange. Other than this im happy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Obviously not as nice as a camelback
customer_reviews.text: Obviously not as nice as a camelback, but it does the job. In fact, my husband has been stealing it from me lately. ..
customer_reviews.author: Animal chick

customer_reviews.title: Good buy but maybe get the black?
customer_reviews.text: I guess it works well enough. The color that i got (orange) looks like it's dirty.
customer_reviews.author: Gigi

customer_reviews.title: It is a nice and light bag
customer_reviews.text: It is a nice and light bag. The fit is pretty good. The only issue I have is with the chest strap and the regular straps, they don't go short enough to fit me properly while I run, so it can make it a bit awkward. But otherwise I love it. The chest strap even comes with a tiny whistle, which is wonderful. It's quite loud so you can hear it if your lost or in trouble. I would definitely recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: Accurate description
customer_reviews.text: Good design, but after soaking it for hours, multiple different times, the bladder still tastes like plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again in a heartbeat
customer_reviews.text: What a steal on this. Do yourself a favor; stop comparing it to the other brands out there, it is just as good.
customer_reviews.author: Nikster

customer_reviews.title: Wish I would have bought one with a zipper pocket ...
customer_reviews.text: Wish I would have bought one with a zipper pocket. The only pocket on this one faces the outside and everyone can see what you have in it, which is certainly not ideal
customer_reviews.author: Ryan F. Rundle

customer_reviews.title: very nice quality for the money
customer_reviews.text: very nice quality for the money, alot of people said theirs leaks but I don't think it leaks I think it just "sweats" like a water bottle would which is fine, if ur using this ur probly going to be sweaty anyways so you won't even notice. Holds a good amount of water and the straw works well and the mouth piece is very comfortable to use.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Nicely serves its purpose for hydrating while running
customer_reviews.text: Nicely serves its purpose for hydrating while running. Allows me to keep a small snack with me as well. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: If you pull the little bite plug off and suck through the tube that way
customer_reviews.text: If you pull the little bite plug off and suck through the tube that way, it's a great way to stay hydrated while hiking.
customer_reviews.author: Kristal

customer_reviews.title: Solid product
customer_reviews.text: It's cheaper than most but very durable. I really like how it's held up. Had it for about 6 months. Use it twice a week.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not a camelback for sure. Quality is lower but quite usable for a beginner mtbiker.
customer_reviews.author: GMac

customer_reviews.title: Nice little hydration pack
customer_reviews.text: Nice little hydration pack. Has kind of a plasticy taste which is slowly fading. I've taken it on 4 or 5 trail runs of 5 - 10 miles. Rides nicely with very little bouncing, no chafing. Takes a little suction to get the water out. I've taken to leaning backward against trees squeezing the pack that way if I'm really thirsty, but most of the time it's fine. I really like the little mesh pouch with the bungee in the back. Holds a cell phone and a small first aid kit. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: David R. Willson

customer_reviews.title: convenient, good quality, good price
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome and not as pricey as the camelbacks. very convenient to use, simply fill the pouch with water and you can sip on it through the tube. they are tiny so don't try stuffing more than one other small item inside.
customer_reviews.author: Penelope Santana

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: Quality backpack at a good price. No complaints, exactly as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew D. Stone

customer_reviews.title: ... use it for long runs and it is a good lightweight pack that stays put and doesn't bounce around
customer_reviews.text: I use it for long runs and it is a good lightweight pack that stays put and doesn't bounce around.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: ... tricky to get the water out at first but fine once you got the hang of it
customer_reviews.text: It was a bit tricky to get the water out at first but fine once you got the hang of it. Comfortable pack, great deal for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This pack has never leaked. It has never tasted odd. It is perfect for my needs. I ran a half-marathon with it. It is the best purchase I made for $25!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Product, Easily used.  Wish it had a secure pocket.
customer_reviews.text: Used for a year now while dirtbiking. Has held up well and is easily used. My only wish was that it had a secure pocket to put keys etc. in.
customer_reviews.author: Canadian Scouter

customer_reviews.title: I really loved this hydration pack
customer_reviews.text: I really loved this hydration pack! I purchased it before a two day musical festival and I do not regret it. The two liter water pack kept me hydrated the whole weekend. Great price.
customer_reviews.author: Juliana Simpson

customer_reviews.title: The pull force to open it is pretty high. Great pack otherwise
customer_reviews.text: The mouth piece does not let enough liquid to pass. The pull force to open it is pretty high. Great pack otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Reto Haggenmueller

customer_reviews.title: and fits great on me
customer_reviews.text: This little water back pack is exactly what it says it. It is well made, durable, and fits great on me. Would suggest it to anyone who needs one.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Eh...
customer_reviews.text: Not bad for the money, but if you're a serious hiker, invest in a higher quality bladder pack
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Should have tested it beforehand...
customer_reviews.text: As another review stated, my bag is leaking from the bottom. I didn't use it till the day I had to use it at Bonnaroo, at which time it starting soaking my shoes. After taking 20 minutes to try to find the problem, I came up empty handed, but could clearly see where the water was leaking out where the hose connected to the bottom of the bag. I'd love to have to alter my review to a 5 star, but first I need a working bag!
customer_reviews.author: Kyle G

customer_reviews.title: Hydration Pack - bladder seam leak
customer_reviews.text: I like the pack just fine, unfortunately after only about 4 months (maybe 8 uses) the bladder developed a leak on the bottom seam. This makes it un-usable unless you like water dripping down your back. I'm now looking to get a replacement, but not sure if i should bother with Teton or change to another brand. I have another popular brand, but it is a larger pack, and i prefer the lower weight. Not sure if this is a prevalent issue so i giving 3 stars in order to be fair.
customer_reviews.author: StephenTP

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great bag and bladder. Use it for backpack without bladder too
customer_reviews.author: Traceylg

customer_reviews.title: Back pack is lightweight, fits to the body well ...
customer_reviews.text: Back pack is lightweight, fits to the body well so it doesn't slide around while running, (I am quite petite tho,) and fits other 2litter bladders. The bladder it came with is hard to drink out of and leaks a bit. I decided to keep packaging for leak protection, just leave the bladder inside the plastic bag after filling, then place back into the backpack.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great entry pack, no holes
customer_reviews.text: Used in hawaii hiking, really great price, no issues with holes. Could use more pockets but im cheap so this fit the bill.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: More for Men....
customer_reviews.text: It is a good pack but I'd say it is made for someone with broader shoulders/chest. It bounced because I couldn't get it tight enough so I gave it to my husband and bought a women's fit pack.
customer_reviews.author: Meppy L

customer_reviews.title: ... tad bit larger than I wanted but I do like it.
customer_reviews.text: I tad bit larger than I wanted but I do like it.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Failed on my first run
customer_reviews.text: I cleaned it out and tested it before my run and was working fine. 3 miles into my long run, go to take my first sip and nothing!!!! I thought it may have to do with the hose, it’s super super long and I coiled it around inside the pack. But after taking it out, still nothing!!! I had to stop, undo everything and take water directly from the bladder for the rest of my run, I was soooo bummed! I guess you get what you pay for with this cheaper model. I returned the item with no problems
customer_reviews.author: Megan Goode

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I never got to use it for my Spartan Race. One I filled with water, it started to leak. I threw it away.
customer_reviews.author: I love NYC!

product_meta.title: TETON Sports TrailRunner 2.0 Hydration Pack; Backpack for Hiking, Running and Cycling; Free 2-Liter Hydration Bladder
product_meta.description: Satisfy your thirst for adventure with the TrailRunner 2.0, by TETON Sports. This hydration backpack comes with a leakproof 2-Liter hydration bladder and is thoughtfully designed with you in mind. The 9” (23 cm) deep mesh pocket that will securely carry all the things you need on the trail. You can adjust the shoulder, chest, and waist straps to get a comfortable fit.
feature_bullets: SATISFY YOUR THIRST FOR ADVENTURE: Lightweight and comfortable hydration backpack; This pack is a terrific companion to keep you hydrated while running, cycling, hiking or any adventure outdoors
FREE HYDRATION BLADDER: 2-Liter; Durable, kink-free sip tube and push-lock cushioned bite valve; Large 2-inch (5 cm) opening for ice and easy cleaning
CUSTOMIZABLE COMFORT: Backpack for men, women, and youth; Adjusts to fit all frames; Comfortable mesh covered shoulder straps mean you can wear this pack for hours
TRUSTED QUALITY: Over 1,000 verified 5-star reviews testifying to the quality and design; Large mesh pocket for your wallet, phone, and snacks
TETON SPORTS PROMISE: Reach out to our AMAZING product support team if you have any questions or concerns; YOU CAN COUNT ON US to get you taken care of and back OUTDOORS with TETON Sports

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
